name: Class notes from Coursera "Startup Engineering" Summer 2013
body:
### Observations

* Emacs is horrible. I have completely forgotten Emacs, and I really don't care to relearn.
* Assignments are at this point just a bunch of steps you follow. It covers a lot of ground pretty quickly. Benefit is that you do get somewhere, instead of building all the foundational knowledge.

### Side Project

I want to set up continuous integration with Heroku on AWS via a project called [Strider Continuous Deployment](http://stridercd.com/)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
